title: Unable to export SavedModel: AttributeError: 'Model' object has no attribute 'model'
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
After successfully training, loading and initializing a model, I'm unable to save it for serving.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'colab.google.com'
2. Click on '+ Code'
3. Scroll down to 'New code cell.'
4. Type
from ludwig.api import LudwigModel
ludwig_model = LudwigModel.load("/content/results/experiment_run_0/model")
ludwig_model.initialize_model(train_set_metadata_json="results/experiment_run_0/model/train_set_metadata.json")
ludwig_model.save_for_serving("for_serving")
4. See error

AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-29-2822eb1daa29> in <module>()
----> 1 ludwig_model.save_for_serving("for_serving")

1 frames
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/models/model.py in save_savedmodel(self, save_path)
   1363             },
   1364             strip_default_attrs=True,
-> 1365             saver=self.model.saver,
   1366         )
   1367         builder.save()

AttributeError: 'Model' object has no attribute 'model'

Please provide code, yaml definition file and a sample of data in order to entirely reproduce the issue.


input_features:
    -
        name: Questions
        type: text
        encoder: bert
        config_path: uncased_L-12_H-768_A-12/bert_config.json
        checkpoint_path: uncased_L-12_H-768_A-12/bert_model.ckpt
        preprocessing:
          word_tokenizer: bert
          word_vocab_file: uncased_L-12_H-768_A-12/vocab.txt
          padding_symbol: '[PAD]'
          unknown_symbol: '[UNK]'

output_features:
    -
        name: Category0
        type: category
    -
        name: Category2
        type: category
text:
        word_sequence_length_limit: 128
training:
        batch_size: 32
        learning_rate: 0.00002

Dataset: https://www.kaggle.com/ananthu017/question-classification

Issues that are not reproducible will be ignored.

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

I expect the exported SavedModel so I can use it to serving.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Jupyter (Colab)
 - Version: Kernel Python 3
- Python version: 3.6.8
- Ludwig version: 0.2

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
